reason: This paper presents Stable Consistency Tuning (SCT), a novel method that improves the training of consistency models for image generation.  SCT addresses issues like high training variance and discretization errors by incorporating variance-reduced learning and a smoother training schedule.  The method achieves state-of-the-art results on benchmark datasets.
takeaways: Stable Consistency Tuning (SCT) significantly improves the training stability and convergence speed of consistency models.
SCT incorporates variance-reduced learning and a smoother training schedule to address the limitations of previous methods.
SCT achieves state-of-the-art performance on CIFAR-10 and ImageNet-64, setting a new benchmark for consistency models.
tldr: Stable Consistency Tuning (SCT) improves consistency model training by reducing variance and discretization errors, leading to faster convergence and state-of-the-art image generation quality on CIFAR-10 and ImageNet-64.
